metadata.synopsis: An old-time Hollywood producer (Burt Reynolds) goes to extremes to wrest a promising script from a younger studio executive (Benjamin Bratt).

reviews: This mournful comedy benefits from a certain soulfulness in Reynolds' treatment of a once-successful, at least modestly talented producer who genuinely believes he still has something to offer.

... directed by and also starring Burt Reynolds, a slapstick take on Hollywood corruption, ought to be funnier than it is considering all the brand-name buddies Burt has dragooned into showing up to show off...
Burt Reynolds and Charles Durning are hugely appealing in this seriocomic look at Hollywood has-beens and hangers-on.
The name is Burt Reynolds and don't you forget it. Please.
